changeRepositionOverride.theText: Be within 2 spaces of a citizen.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
Labyrinthine service tunnels wind throughout the lower levels of Cloud City. Traditionally, the Ugnaughts use these passages to perform maintenance, but you've tracked a Trandoshan here from Port Town.

Supply closets have been converted to crowded cells. The Ugnaughts seem not to mind, but more likely have been paid off. You take a breath and charge in.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked to Imperial figures.
{-} Mission tokens represent citizens. When a hero is on or adjacent to a citizen and there is no Imperial figure within 2 spaces of that citizen, that citizen is freed.
{-} The mission will progress when all citizens have been freed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked to Imperial figures.
{-} Mission tokens represent citizens. When a hero is on or adjacent to a citizen and there is no Imperial figure within 2 spaces of that citizen, that citizen is freed.
{-} The mission will progress when all citizens have been freed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win campaign
globalEvents.eventText:
Panicking, Bossk squeezes his way through a jammed door, leaving part of his arm behind. The citizens are safe, and the slavers are on the run.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Heroes receive the “Lobot’s Favor” Reward card.

eventActions.theText:
You make sure to fully scout the area, leaving no civilian behind. Their gratitude is overwhelming, and more than a few vow to aid the Rebellion however they can. It’s good to know that the fight will continue, even after your mission is complete.

You return to the battlefield. A stroke of luck! In the bounty hunter's detached hand is the datapad he was so proud of. Eager for good news, you review the journal of a Rebel agent, codename: Sparrow.

The datapad contains communications between Sparrow and a second agent, Dragon. It seems the two were integral pieces of Rebel intelligence on Cloud City. Dragon claims to have stolen Imperial codes and other classified information from the ISB. Also in the journal are several maps. One location is circled as a dead drop the spies used to transfer secrets.

Finally on the right trail, you prepare to retrieve the codes. The fate of your agents is unknown, but you determine to finish the job.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP. Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Cloud City’s Secret”.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
You were not the only ones with backup. A wall blows open and Bossk escapes behind a barrage of blaster fire. Lobot opens a back door, and you retreat to safety.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.theText: Did you play this mission as part of the "The Bespin Gambit" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: Campaign Defeat Yes
globalEvents.eventText:
Your hearts sink as you realize that Bossk slipped away with a Rebel agent’s datapad. Even if it somehow wasn't the key to your mission, the ISB will tear it apart. Information is a weapon. The secrets a spy carries could end the Rebellion on Cloud City.

En route back to headquarters, a guerrilla runner intercepts you with an urgent message. Lando Calrissian made a risky play for the datapad and was captured by the ISB. He will certainly be questioned by the merciless Interrogator, Blaise.

To make matters worse, sliced security footage shows troopers preparing your ally for carbon-freezing. If Lando is taken off world, he may never be seen again!

{-} Each hero receives 2 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Hostile Takeover”.

globalEvents.name: Campaign No
globalEvents.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Free Lobot
globalEvents.eventText:
You remove the inhibitor chip and Lobot bows in appreciation. "Thank you", he says calmly. "The inhibitor chip has severly limited by defensive capacities, but maybe I can help you with the security blast doors."

Lobot points to a couple of slots in the ceiling where blast doors can close.

eventActions.theText:
"Let me know when you need one of them closed. I have limited power supply, but the more power you divert from the cell doors, the more blast doors I will be able to close."

{-} During his activation, a hero may choose to suffer 1 {C} to click Lobot (adjacency is not required) and close one of the blast doors on the map or open a door that a hero placed. Limit once per activation.
{-} The heroes can only close as many blast doors as they have opened cell doors.
{-} Doors placed by heroes are locked. A figure can attack a locked door (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).

entityProperties.name: Lobot
entityProperties.theText:
Lobot, Cloud City's computer liaison officer, calmly waits for your orders.

{-} During his activation, a hero may choose to suffer 1 {C} to click Lobot and close one of the blast doors on the map or open a door that a hero placed. Limit once per activation.
{-} The heroes can only close as many blast doors as they have opened cell doors.

{-} The mission will progress when all citizens have been freed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Free Citizen 2
globalEvents.eventText: The Ugnaught thanks you and quickly rushes off.

globalEvents.eventText: The door slides open to reveal a tiny cramped space with someone cowering inside.

globalEvents.name: Lobot out of power
globalEvents.eventText: "That's it", Lobot says. "There's nothing more I can do right now."

entityProperties.name: Lobot
entityProperties.theText: Lobot, Cloud City's computer liaison officer, calmly waits for you to free the remaining citizens.

globalEvents.name: Lobot power again
globalEvents.eventText: "Alrigth", Lobot's voice comes over comlink. "Doors are operational again."

entityProperties.name: Lobot
entityProperties.theText:
Lobot, Cloud City's computer liaison officer, calmly waits for your orders.

{-} During his activation, a hero may choose to suffer 1 {C} to click Lobot and close one of the blast doors on the map or open a door that a hero placed. Limit once per activation.
{-} The heroes can only close as many blast doors as they have opened cell doors.

globalEvents.name: Escape Alert
globalEvents.eventText:
As more and more captives are freed, the bounty hunter's allies arrive to stop you.

{-} If the Junk Droid is on the map, it becomes <color="red">Focused</color>. Otherwise, place the Junk Droid on a space adjacent to any Rebel figure.

eventActions.theText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "The Bespin Gambit" mini campaign?

globalEvents.name: Containment Yes
globalEvents.eventText:
Bossk returns to find his captives have escaped. Before he can run, Lobot slams the exits shut. Undeterred, the bounty hunter flashes a twisted grin and taunts you with a Rebel datapad.

{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Bossk</color> is defeated.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{A} INDISCRIMINATE FIRE: If there is at least 1 Rebel within 3 spaces, roll 1 red die. One Rebel within 3 spaces suffers {H} equal to the {H} results. Then each figure adjacent to that Rebel other than this figure suffers 1 {H}.
{Q} Move 5 to attack {rebel}.
{Q}{A} Move 7 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 4 to reposition 3.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 3.

{-} Doors placed by heroes are locked. A figure can attack a locked door (Health: *1*, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Bossk</color> is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.
